The search results provide comprehensive information about contemporary reading habits of J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Hobbit" among Polish youth, fandom activities, and Tolkien conventions. Here's what I found:

## Contemporary Reading of "The Hobbit" Among Polish Youth

The Hobbit is clearly directed at children and youth, and it utilizes the motif of animism, which is often used in literature for children and youth. The novel is primarily aimed at younger readers, which is evident in the lightness of the narrative and a decidedly more accessible style, language and narration.

## Reading Habits and Accessibility

While it may seem that long and detailed descriptions would allow readers to dive deeper into the presented world, for a book that is rather aimed at younger readers, because it's young people who reach for this position already in school, it is too cumbersome. However, despite the clumsiness, one cannot take away from this position that it is an ideal way to jump into the world of Tolkienian adventure.

The Hobbit is often recommended as a good starting point, especially for younger readers or people new to the fantasy world, and The Hobbit, originally written for children, offers a lighter, more accessible narrative.

## Tolkien Fandom and Conventions in Poland

The search results reveal an active Polish Tolkien fan community. There are topics for writing complete lists of Tolkien positions found in libraries and boasting about new acquisitions, indicating active collecting and discussion among Polish fans.

His influence on literature and pop culture is enormous, and the fan community worldwide still celebrates his work through various initiatives, conventions and fan-created works. The Tolkien fan community is extremely active and engaged. Fans around the world organize conventions, create fan works and celebrate his creativity in diverse ways. Fan clubs and conventions that emerged in the 1960s continue to develop and attract new enthusiasts.

## LubimyCzytac.pl Platform

The search shows that LubimyCzytac.pl features "The Hobbit" as a "masterpiece of fantasy literature" with a "fairy-tale, thoughtfully detailed fantastic world and colorful characters and their wonderful adventures". The platform serves as an important space for Polish readers to share opinions and ratings of Tolkien's works.

## Contemporary Relevance

The founding father of contemporary fantasy literature is an invaluable figure for all lovers of the genre. The world created by Tolkien is still a source of inspiration for many creators of literature, films and games. Film adaptations of "The Lord of the Rings" and "The Hobbit" had a huge impact on contemporary pop culture, introducing Tolkien's universe to a wider audience... Thanks to them, new generations can discover the rich world of Middle-earth, which promotes a revival of interest in fantasy literature.

The results indicate that "The Hobbit" remains highly relevant in contemporary Polish youth reading culture, supported by active fan communities, conventions, and digital platforms like LubimyCzytac.pl that facilitate discussion and engagement with Tolkien's works.
